info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:57AM CDT until June 08 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT FOR PERRY...SOUTHEASTERN CONWAY...SOUTHERN FAULKNER...NORTHEASTERN GARLAND...NORTHWESTERN SALINE...SOUTH CENTRAL YELL...NORTHWESTERN PULASKI AND SOUTHEASTERN POPE COUNTIES... At 757 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oppelo to Perry to 6 miles south of Adona to 10 miles southeast of Plainview in Yell County, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Conway... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Hot Springs Village... Morrilton... Perryville... Vilonia... Mayflower... Oppelo... Menifee... Perry... Adona... Houston... Sequoya Park... Little Italy... Olmstead... Roland in Pulaski County... Toad Suck... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 101 and 147. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
